results.name: If n is odd, then a(n) = 0; otherwise, a(n) = n.
comment: Normally the OEIS excludes sequences in which every other term is zero. But there are exceptions for especially important sequences like this one. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 27 2014
Essentially the factorial expansion of exp(-1): exp(-1) = sum(n>=1, a(n)/(n+1)! ). [_Joerg Arndt_, Mar 13 2014]
a(n) is the number of m < n for which a(m) has the same parity as n. For instance, a(4) = 4 because 4 has the same parity as a(0), a(1), a(2), and a(3). - _Alec Jones_, May 16 2016

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,-1).
formula: a(n) = floor(n^(-1)^n) for n>1. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 27 2015
